column2: ENGLISH
column6: SPANISH

column1: # Former religion head was sacrificed by other faith

column2: The [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] is Dead
column6: El [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] ha muerto

column2: [FromFrom.GetFirstName], the former head of the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith, hangs from a branch, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] lifeless eyes bulging. Some children steal [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] preposterous hat and laugh as they pass it around. Overhead ravens are already circling, preparing for their own part in the feast.\n\nWhat will the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s think when they learn of this glorious victory for your faith, when they learn you have killed their spiritual leader? Will they shake with fear at the sound of the Allfather's name? As you ponder these questions, the ravens descend and begin their bloody work...
column6: [FromFrom.GetFirstName], [FromFrom.GetElLa] antiguo líder de la religión [FromFrom.Religion.GetName], cuelga de un árbol, con los ojos hinchados. Algunos críos han robado su gorro absurdo y ríen mientras se lo pasan. En las alturas, los cuervos vuelan ya en círculos, esperando su parte del festín.\n\n¿Qué pensarán los otros [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s cuando sepan de esta victoria para tu fe, cuando sepan que has matado su líder espiritual? ¿Temblarán de miedo cuando escuchen el nombre de Odín? Mientras reflexionas, los cuervos descienden y empiezan su sangriento trabajo...

column2: [Root.GetBestName] has sacrificed the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] at a Blot. Even now the so-called holy [FromFrom.GetManWoman] hangs from a tree branch, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] corpse torn by ravens.\n\nDoes this auspicious occasion mean the eventual triumph of your [Root.Religion.GetName] faith? Or will the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s be inspired to strike back against those they hold responsible?
column6: [Root.GetBestName] ha sacrificado al [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] en el banquete. El así llamado [FromFrom.GetManWoman] sagrado cuelga ahora de un árbol, con el cuerpo despedazado por los cuervos.\n\n¿Significa este auspicioso hecho el triunfo de tu fe [Root.Religion.GetName]? ¿O inspirará a los otros [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s a vengarse contra los responsables?

column2: The body of the former [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] lies on the temple floor, its throat cut. The collected blood has already been passed around among the guests and many have tasted it, their lips unnaturally red, chins flecked, mustaches dripping. The statue of Kali looms over everything, including the corpse of poor [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. Kali's expression is, as always, one of rage—her eyes fierce, her mouth ready to devour.\n\nWill the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s tremble in fear when they learn of this act? Will they be humbled, as they should be? And will Kali see fit to spare any soul, even yours? With these thoughts swirling in your mind, you take the skull cup, still full of blood, and set it to your lips...
column6: El cuerpo del antiguo [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] está tirado en el suelo del templo, con la garganta cortada. La sangre recogida se ha compartido entre los invitados y muchos la han probado, sus labios rojos, las mejillas moteadas y los bigotes goteantes. La estatua de Kali se cierne sobre todos, incluyendo el cuerpo del pobre [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. La expresión de Kali es, como siempre, rabiosa, lista para devorar.\n\n¿Temblarán el resto de [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s cuando sepan de este hecho? ¿Estarán humillados, como deberían? ¿Considerará Kali perdonar alguna alma? Con estos pensamientos rondando tu mente, coges la copa de cráneo, llena de sangre, y la acercas a tus labios...

column2: [Root.GetBestName] has sacrificed the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] at a Kali Puja feast. At this moment the so-called holy [FromFrom.GetManWoman] lies dead, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] throat cut, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] blood served to guests.\n\nIs this momentous occasion proof that your [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is superior? Or will the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s find a new motivation to wage war against those they hold responsible?
column6: [Root.GetBestName] ha sacrificado al [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] en el banquete a Kali Puja. En estos momentos, [FromFrom.GetElLa] Sant[FromFrom.GetOA] [FromFrom.GetManWoman] yace muerto, con la garganta cortada, y su sangre servida a los invitados.\n\n¿Es esto una prueba de que tu religión [Root.Religion.GetName] es superior? ¿O encontrarán los otros [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s una motivación para declarar la guerra a los responsables?

column2: [FromFrom.GetFirstName], once the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle], has succumbed to the judgment of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. [FromFrom.GetPossPronounCap] lifeless body, still in the sand where [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] was half-buried, is burned red, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] lips dried and cracked. Flies swarm about [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] exposed head. Vultures watch from nearby perches, waiting for their chance at the corpse.\n\nThrough this act, it appears as though [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] has actually delivered judgment upon all the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s. How else could such an event be interpreted? Why did their [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] not deliver this supposed holy [FromFrom.GetManWoman]? And truly, how bright can their god be compared to the Sun itself? With these thoughts in your mind, you retreat and let the desert scavengers do what they will...
column6: [FromFrom.GetFirstName], una vez [FromFrom.GetElLa] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName], ha sucumbido al juicio de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Su cuerpo sin vida, aún en la arena medio enterrado, está quemado por el Sol, sus labios secos y agrietados. Las moscas revolotean sobre su cabeza. Los buitres observan desde lo alto, esperando su oportunidad.\n\nCon este acto, parece que [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] ha obrado justicia sobre los [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s. ¿De qué otra forma se puede interpretar? ¿Por qué [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] no liberó a su [FromFrom.GetManWoman] Sant[FromFrom.GetOA]? ¿Y cómo puede compararse su dios con el mismísimo Sol? Con estos pensamientos te retiras y dejas que las bestias del desierto jueguen con el cuerpo...

column2: [Root.GetBestName] has submitted the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] to the judgment of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and the Sun has not been merciful. The so-called holy [FromFrom.GetManWoman] is dead, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] corpse picked apart by desert scavengers.\n\nDoes this mean [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] will lead you to victory against the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s? Or will the heathens instead muster their armies and do battle with those they hold responsible?
column6: [Root.GetBestName] ha entregado [FromFrom.GetAlAla] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] al juicio de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], y el Sol no ha sido clemente. [FromFrom.GetElLaCap] así llamad[FromFrom.GetOA] sant[FromFrom.GetOA] está muert[FromFrom.GetOA], con el cuerpo despedazado por las bestias.\n\n¿Significa esto que [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] te llevará a la victoria contra los demás [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s? ¿O llevarán estos paganos sus ejércitos a la batalla contra los responsables?

column2: The body of [FromFrom.GetFirstName], the [FromFrom.GetManWoman] who called [FromFrom.GetReflexivePronoun] the [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle], rolls down the temple steps and comes to a stop in a broken heap. A trail of blood marks the path of [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] descent. At the top of the temple a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] stands with a human heart in one hand and an obsidian knife in the other, both still dripping blood. Mighty [Root.Culture.GetName] warriors cheer at the sight, comforted by the knowledge that [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will subsist and the heavens will keep turning.\n\nWill these [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] weaklings now cower in fear at the might of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]? Or will they persist in their struggles against you? Either way, you know many of them will meet the same fate as their [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle]...
column6: El cuerpo de [FromFrom.GetFirstName], [FromFrom.GetElLa] [FromFrom.GetManWoman] que se hacía llamar [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle], rueda por el templo escalones abajo. Un rastro de sangre marca el camino de su descenso. En lo alto del templo, un [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] se alza con un corazón en una mano y un cuchillo de obsidiana en la otra, aún goteando sangre. Fuertes guerreros [Root.Culture.GetName]s aplauden, confortados por saber que [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] perdurará y los cielos seguirán girando.\n\n¿Se encogerán de miedo estos [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] ante el poder de [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]? ¿O continuarán resistiéndose a tu autoridad? De cualquiera de las maneras, sabes que muchos tendrán el mismo destino que su [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle]...

column2: [Root.GetBestName] has sacrificed the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] to the Gods. The supposed holy [FromFrom.GetManWoman] lies at the foot of an [Root.Religion.GetName] temple, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] heart cut from [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] chest.\n\nAnd yet it is not enough—many others must be sacrificed, if the cosmos is to be sustained. The other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s will surely resist your efforts.
column6: [Root.GetBestName] ha sacrificado [FromFrom.GetAlAla] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] a los Dioses. [FromFrom.GetElLa] supuest[FromFrom.GetOA] [FromFrom.GetManWoman] sant[FromFrom.GetOA] yace a los pies del templo [Root.Religion.GetName], con el corazón arrancado del pecho.\n\nY aún así, no se han sacrificado a los suficientes si tiene que mantenerse el orden del cosmos. Los otros [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s se resistirán a tus esfuerzos.

column2: Word has arrived that a [GetFromRootInsult] by the name of [Root.GetBestName] has captured [FromFrom.GetBestName] and then sacrificed [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] at a heathen ritual. While you don't know the details of it, the monstrousness of the action is clear. The former [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] has been debased, desecrated, used like an animal.\n\nWhy has [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] allowed this to happen? Is this evidence that all [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s have been forsaken? Surely something must be done about these barbaric [Root.Religion.GetName]s. Such a profane act cannot go unpunished!
column6: Llegan rumores de que un [GetFromRootInsult] con el nombre de [Root.GetBestName] ha capturado a [FromFrom.GetBestName] y después lo ha sacrificado en un ritual pagano. Aunque desconoces los detalles, la monstruosidad del acto es claro. [FromFrom.GetElLa] antigu[FromFrom.GetOA] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] ha sido degradado, profanado y usado como un animal.\n\n¿Por qué ha permitido [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] que pase ésto? ¿Significa que todos los [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s han sido olvidados? De todos modos, estos bárbaros [Root.Religion.GetName]s deben ser castigados. ¡Un acto tan blasfemo no puede salir impune!

column2: Word has arrived that a [GetFromRootInsult] by the name of [Root.GetBestName] has captured [FromFrom.GetBestName] of the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith and sacrificed [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] at a barbaric ritual. While it doesn't directly concern your own faith, it is still a worrying development.\n\nAre any good [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s safe from these foreign predations? Who else will be made victims of profane rites performed for heathen gods? Perhaps something must be done.
column6: Llegan rumores de que un [GetFromRootInsult] con el nombre de [Root.GetBestName] ha capturado a [FromFrom.GetBestName] de la fe [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] y lo ha sacrificado en un ritual sanguinario. Aunque no afecta directamente a tu religión, es preocupante.\n\n¿Están los buenos [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s a salvo de estos depredadores extranjeros? ¿Quién más serán víctimas de sus rituales profanos? A lo mejor debemos hacer algo.

column2: Rumors spreading through your realm say that a [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] has been taken prisoner and was recently sacrificed at a ritual by [Root.GetBestName]. If true, it may signal the growing power of the [Root.Religion.GetName] people and the waning of the [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s. How powerful can they be, if they cannot protect their spiritual leaders?
column6: Los rumores extendidos a través del reino dicen que [FromFrom.GetElLa] [FromFrom.RelHead.GetTitle] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] ha sido tomad[FromFrom.GetOA] prisionero y sacrificad[FromFrom.GetOA] en un ritual por  [Root.GetBestName]. De ser cierto, podría ser una señal del creciente poder de los [Root.Religion.GetName] y del fin de los [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s. ¿Cuán poderosos pueden ser, si no puede proteger a sus líderes espirituales?

column2: [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is triumphant!
column6: ¡[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] triunfa!

column2: Let them try. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is with us!
column6: Deja que lo intenten. ¡[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] está con nosotros!

column2: [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] defend us.
column6: [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName] defiéndenos.

column2: These [Root.Religion.GetName] folk might be trouble...
column6: Estos [Root.Religion.GetName] podrían ser un problema...

column2: [FromFrom.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] fails them once again.
column6: [FromFrom.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] les falla otra vez.

column1: # Notify other players of a fellow player's death

column2: Fellow player §Y[From.GetBestName]§! [From.GetDeathReason].
column6: El jugador §Y[From.GetBestName]§! ha muerto por [From.GetDeathReason].

column2: Founding of an Empire
column6: Fundar un Imperio

column2: Your realm stretches from horizon to horizon. The armies you command have crushed all foes. The prosperity of your people is undeniable. Clearly you are favored by [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and it seems fitting and just that you should be called [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName] and exalted above other rulers.\n\nThere will surely still be challenges ahead, but under your leadership the [Root.Culture.GetName] people enter a new age. Whether that age is one of further glory or ultimate destruction will be determined by your guiding hand.
column6: Tu reino se extiende de un horizonte a otro. Tus ejércitos aplastan a todos tus enemigos. La prosperidad de tu gente es innegable. Claramente estás favorecido por [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], y parece justo que seas nombrad[FromFrom.GetOA] [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName] y aclamad[FromFrom.GetOA] sobre otros gobernantes.\n\n.Seguro que te esperan muchos retos, pero bajo tu liderazgo comienza una nueva era. Si se trata de una era de gloria o de destrucción lo determinará tus decisiones.

column2: With the undeniable might of your realm and the flourishing of your people as the justification, you have named yourself [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. No one dares question your power in the earthly domain.\n\nBut even now many are whispering of the boldness, and perhaps even the presumption, of naming yourself as such. Are you deserving of such a title? Is that not for God to decide? What does the Holy Father say? Without Papal blessing, it may be difficult to convince even your own loyal subjects of your right to call yourself [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle].
column6: Con el innegable poder de tu reino y el bienestar de tu gente como justificacion, te has titulado [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. Nadie se atreve a cuestionar tu poder en el plano terrenal.\n\nPero aún hay quienes cuchichean sobre la audacia, y tal vez atrevimiento, de nombrarte a ti mismo como tal. ¿Te mereces ese título? ¿No es cosa de Dios decidirlo? ¿Qué dirá el Santo Padre? Sin la bendición Papal, puede que sea difícil convencer hasta a tus más leales súbditos del derecho de llamarte a ti mism[FromFrom.GetOA] [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle].

column2: [Root.GetDynName] has declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] to be [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. It is surely good news that such a mighty Catholic power has risen in this troubled world, and its success may imply that [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] favors it. But while its might cannot be questioned, claiming the title of Emperor seems a presumptuous move when the Pope has not offered his assent or blessing.
column6: [Root.GetDynName] se ha declarado [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. Sin duda buenas noticias que un[FromFrom.GetOA] Católic[FromFrom.GetOA] tan poderos[FromFrom.GetOA] se haya alzado en este mundo caótico, su éxito significa que [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] le favorece. Pero aunque eso sea indudable, reclamar el título de Emperador[FromFrom.GetXA] parece atrevido más cuando el Papa no ha ofrecido su bendición.

column2: [Root.GetDynName] has declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] to be [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. It is surely good news that such a mighty [Root.Religion.GetName] power has risen in this troubled world, and its success may imply that [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] favors it. Perhaps this is the beginning of a new and glorious era for the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
column6: [Root.GetDynName] se ha proclamado [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. Sin duda buenas noticias que un [Root.Religion.GetName] tan poderoso se haya levantado en este mundo caótico, y su éxito implica que [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] le favorece. Tal vez esto sea el comoienzo de una nueva y gloriosa era para la fe [Root.Religion.GetName].

column2: [Root.GetDynName] has declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] to be [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith now has a mighty representative in the earthly domain. But whether they will be good allies to their fellow [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s remains to be seen.
column6: [Root.GetDynName] se ha proclamado [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. La fe [Root.Religion.GetName] tiene ahora un poderoso representante en la Tierra. Pero si será un buen aliado de los otros [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s aún está por ver.

column2: [Root.GetDynName], a heathen [Root.Religion.GetName], has declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] the so-called [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] of [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. Even though he makes a mockery of the very title itself, his power is undeniable. All [This.Religion.GetGroupName]s would do well to be cautious and avoid underestimating this new rival.
column6: [Root.GetDynName], un pagano [Root.Religion.GetName], se ha proclamado [FromFrom.GetRulerTitle] de [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. A pesar de que se burla del mismo título, su poder es innegable. Todos los [This.Religion.GetGroupName]s harían bien en ser cautelosos y evitar subestimar a este nuevo rival.

column2: May our future reign be glorious!
column6: ¡Que nuestro reinado sea próspero!

column2: I'm sure Papal approval is a mere formality.
column6: La aprovación Papal es una mera formalidad.

column2: Surely the Pope must be consulted?
column5: ¿Seguro que el Papa debe ser consultado?

column2: Fantastic!
column6: ¡Fantástico!

column2: At least we believe in the same God?
column6: ¿Al menos creemos en el mismo Dios?

column2: This does not bode well.
column6: Esto no pinta bien.

column2: End of an Empire
column6: Fin del Imperio

column2: Whether by external pressures or internal corruption, the [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName] has been reduced to a remnant of its former glory. No longer seen as a true empire by others, nor able to deem itself as such without risking blasphemy, it has succumbed to its weakness and is forfeit.\n\n[From.GetDynName], the former [From.GetEmperorEmpress], has surrendered [From.GetPossPronoun] imperial crown and accepted the lesser title [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName].
column6: Ya sea por presiones externas o corrupción interna, el [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName] ha sido reducido a un recuerdo de su antigua gloria. Ya no era considerado un imperio por los demás, ni considerarse como tal sin arriesgarse a la blasfemia, ha sucumbido a su debilidad y está perdido.\n\n[From.GetDynName], [From.GetElLa] antigu[From.GetOA] [From.GetEmperorEmpress], ha entregado la corona imperial y ha aceptado el título menor del [From.GetTitle] de [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName].

column2: Charlemagne's once great empire has submitted to a final, inglorious fate and is undone. The dream of reviving the Roman Empire in the West has ended in the same decline and ultimate destruction as befell the Romans of old.\n\n[From.GetDynName], the [From.GetManWoman] who once claimed the [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName] as [From.GetPossPronoun] own, has been reduced to [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]—an ignoble fate for the last successor of Charles the Great.
column6: El otrora gran Imperio de Carlomagno ha llegado a su final. El sueño de recuperar el Imperio Romano en Occidente ha terminado en la misma decadencia y destrucción que conocieron los romanos de antaño.\n\n[From.GetDynName], [From.GetElLa] [From.GetManWoman] que reclamó el [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName] como suyo, ha sido reducido al [From.GetTitle] de [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName] -un destino innoble para los últimos sucesores de Carlos el Grande.

column2: The Empire of the Romans has fallen! Considered by many to be the inheritor and keeper of the legacy of the Roman Empire, and once surely the foremost bastion of Christendom in the East, the [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName] is no more.\n\nWith the Empire broken and Constantinople in the hands of another realm, the former [From.GetEmperorEmpress], [From.GetDynName], has given up [From.GetPossPronoun] imperial throne and become [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName].
column6: ¡El Imperio de Bizancio ha caído! Considerado por muchos el heredero y custodio del legado del Imperio Romano, y otrora el más grande bastión de la Cristiandad en Oriente, el [emf_crier_dead_title.GetFullName], ha sucumbido.\n\nCon el Imperio roto y Constantinopla en manos de otro gobernante, [From.GetElLa] antigu[From.GetOA] [From.GetEmperorEmpress], [From.GetDynName], ha renunciado al trono imperial y se ha convertido en [From.GetTitle] de [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName].

column2: I should send [From.GetTitledFirstName] my sympathies.
column6: Debería enviar mis condolencias a [From.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: Surely a great misfortune.
column6: Una verdadera lástima.

column2: Good riddance.
column6: ¡Hasta nunca!

column2: Perhaps I can turn this to my advantage.
column6: Puedo hacer de esto mi ventaja.

column2: §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! has transfered me a sum of [FromFrom.emf_transfer_wealth_amount.GetValue]¤.
column6: §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! me ha transferido la suma de [FromFrom.emf_transfer_wealth_amount.GetValue]¤.

column2: §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! has transfered §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! a sum of [FromFrom.emf_transfer_wealth_amount.GetValue]¤.
column6: §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! ha transferido a §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! la suma de [FromFrom.emf_transfer_wealth_amount.GetValue]¤.

column2: Sacrificed Head of Religion
column6: Cabeza de la religión sacrificado

column2: Sacrificed Head of Other Faith
column6: Cabeza de otra religión sacrificado

column2: Religious Head Sacrificed by Heathens
column6: Cabeza de la religión sacrificado por paganos
